front.title: Operational Scenarios for IRON and RANGER

abstract.t: The Internet Routing Overlay Network (IRON) [draft-templin-iron] and Routing and Addressing in Networks with Global Enterprise Recursion (RANGER) [RFC5720] provide an architectural framework for scalable routing and addressing. Together, these architectures provide for scalability, provider independence, mobility, multihoming and security for the next generation Internet. This document describes a series of operational use case scenarios in order to showcase the architectural capabilities. It further shows how IRON and RANGER restore the network-within-network principles originally intended for the sustained growth of the Internet.
